courseSectionInformation: 3 or 4 undergraduate hours. 3 or 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: HDFS 206 and HDFS 208.
description: Examines the development needs and stress reactions of children in hospitals and their families; introduces the role of Child Life programs and the Child Life Specialist; examines responses of family and staff facing terminal illness and the death of a child; familiarizes students with general hospital procedures, medical terms, and illnesses. Optional one-hour clinical placement includes direct experience with hospitalized children and their families. 3 or 4 undergraduate hours. 3 or 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: HDFS 206 and HDFS 208.
label: Hospitalized Children
